introduction:
The Python Programming Virtual Lab is a carefully designed platform aimed at equipping students with practical programming skills. This virtual laboratory allows students to gain hands-on experience in fundamental and advanced Python concepts. Through interactive experiments, students explore topics such as complex data types, higher-order functions, lambda expressions, extended formal argument syntax, and exception handling.
This lab is created an extension to the already existing python programming lab, adding 5 more experiments of advanced python to the lab. The lab emphasizes programming techniques essential for solving real-world computational problems and understanding the intricacies of Python programming. By fostering an engaging and structured learning environment, the virtual lab bridges the gap between theoretical programming concepts and their practical application, empowering students to develop industry-relevant skills.

UG: Undergraduate Students (1st Year/2nd Year): These students will benefit most from the foundational and advanced Python programming concepts covered in the lab, making this group the highest priority for development.
Undergraduate Students (3rd Year/4th Year): Advanced-level students will also benefit from the lab's focus on higher-level programming concepts, making them the next higher priority for development

objective:
The primary objectives of the Python Programming Virtual Lab are:
  • To provide students with hands-on experience in Python programming, focusing on core topics such as complex data types, higher-order functions, and lambda functions.
  • To enable students to master extended argument syntax and exception handling, essential skills for writing robust and efficient code.
  • To strengthen students' understanding of the fundamental principles of programming, equipping them with problem-solving abilities applicable across various domains.
  • To provide an engaging, accessible, and interactive platform for students to build strong programming foundations through practical experiments.

courseAlignment.description:
The proposed Python Programming Virtual Lab aligns with the curricula of multiple institutions, ensuring that the lab content meets the learning objectives and enhances academic programs.
The courses that align with the extended experiments for python lab are:
universities: Dibrugarh University: Programming in Python; BTech CSE
IIT Madras: Programming in Python IIT Madras; BTech CSE
IIT Kanpur: Programming in Python IIT Kanpur: BTech CSE
